Articles.Content:
Hey, today I'm going to be sharing the work in progress ISS. Construction is on halt until 0.23 (which releases tomorrow! ) for use of the science labs. So far, Zarya, Unity, Zvezda, the Z1 Truss, and the P6 Truss have been put up in orbit. Destiny is the next module and the plan is to use the science lab. Working on download links. Oh, and the launchers are not replicas. They're just some quickly tossed together asparagus rocket. I tried making the Proton K but it was a failure (like most of my stuff)

This article on Wikipedia has been very helpful and a guide for the chronological sequence of construction. This page on the KSP wiki was also quite helpful for the first 3 modules. teo's ISS has also been a helpful reference (mostly for the solar panels, look here)

Giggleplex777 has made a fantastic stock space shuttle that is actually quite easy to fly, which is nice for transporting crew to the ISS. (1 mission flown so far) http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61780-Showcase-The-real-world-s-largest-rockets?p=841389#post841389

PICTURES (note that the first space shuttle [the one with the one with no cargo bay cover] is my failed design)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited December 17, 2013 by Woopert
Wow, my shuttle looks better attached to a station than by itself.
UPDATE: Added the Destiny laboratory. It uses the new science module. Check the latest pictures on the album if interested.

Really smooth and beautiful, congratulation!

ps: What mod do you use for clouds?

Really smooth and beautiful, congratulation!

ps: What mod do you use for clouds?

Thanks so much! The mod for the clouds is here. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-Release-5-3-Visual-Enhancements-Clouds-City-Lights

For the skybox, in case you are curious, install Universe Replacer and Rareden's skybox in this case, for the stars.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44135-0-22-Universe-Replacer-v4-0

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44135-0-22-Universe-Replacer-v4-0/page120?p=602535&viewfull=1#post602535
